oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rapid solidification of cobalt-titanium alloys induced by nanosecond laser-pulses
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: VITTA, S
GREER, AL
SOMEKH, RE
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: picosecond
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Phase formation is studied in thin films of Co-Ti alloys, both as sputtered and after quenching following melting by a 5 ns laser pulse, The composition ranges for glass formation are established, and the significance of crystal growth kinetics is examined. The Co-Ti system exhibits many types of intermetallic compounds and a wide variety of behaviours is found around their compositions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: MATERIALS SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING A-STRUCTURAL MATERIALS PROPERTIES MICROSTRUCTURE AND PROCESSING,179,243-248
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 8th International Conference on Rapidly Quenched and Metastable Materials,SENDAI, JAPAN,AUG 22-27, 1993
